items.content: Join Our Team! We are Plus+, for 20 years, our company has believed in the transformative power of information to help people and businesses thrive. We empower our clients by focusing on their business objectives in order to deliver appropriate holistic technology solutions, bridging the gap between business and technology. Our Culture is dynamic! We are committed to being a "People First" organization and we strongly believe that the success of our team also empowers our organization to excel as a whole. Plus+ is consistently recognized as a "Best Workplace" by Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, has been featured as one of "Pittsburgh's Coolest Offices" by Biz Journal and was also a finalist for "Culture Leader of the Year" by the Pittsburgh Technology Council. Our fun and collaborative culture encourages our people to do their best work every day and we strive to recognize individuals on their strengths by providing opportunities for growth, including certifications and continuing education. We take pride in enabling our people to make decisions daily that contribute to their career, wellness & confidence. What's Your Role: Plus is seeking a Senior Consultant/Developer, that will contribute to identifying, communicating, and solving highly visible business practices, processes, and technology issues for our clients. The Senior Consultant/Developer will participate in delivering business solutions in a team oriented, collaborative environment. The focus of the senior consultant is to participate in design, solution architecture, technical architecture, and development and implementation efforts of business solutions. How You'll Contribute: Provides consulting services Guides clients and team members to resolve requirements of varying complexity Determines implementation options using best practices approach Architects technical solutions to the appropriate needs of the client, based on Salesforce platform and client IT environment, both internally and cloud based Analyzes client data requirements and interprets into migration and/or integration transformation specifications Develops, unit tests and modifies Apex code using structured methodology Develops and deploys solutions that meet client requirements in a scalable and repeatable manner Provides clear and concise estimates to sales and delivery teams Communicates clearly and consistently Provides ongoing communication to team members, management and clients Communicates with clients to provide updates on inquiries across projects and support initiatives Participates in team meetings and updates internal systems in a timely manner Meets professional standards Develops quality deliverables and provides guidance to others on deliverables Adheres to project deadlines and commitments Exceeds customer expectations of professionalism Strives to remain technically proficient in technology innovations Acts as a client advocate Understands business value in solutions Balances client requirements against competing efforts and project risk factors What's Needed for Success (Skills/Experience/Education) Required Skills: Experience with custom development using the Force.com platform including Apex, Visualforce, SOQL and SOSL Experience with Java, C#, C++, .NET or other related languages, and experience with developing enterprise applications Experience with relevant scripting, mark-up & styling languages (JavaScript, HTML, XML, CSS, etc.) Proficiency in Salesforce.com declarative configuration Skilled at analyzing, troubleshooting and solving problems Experience with development methodologies and concepts Understanding of enterprise solution architecture as it pertains to scalability, systems integration, etc. Extensive experience with relevant IDEs, deployment methodologies, and system testing Demonstrated ability to learn quickly in a rapid-paced environment Excellent bidirectional verbal and written communication skills Experience using common business applications (Microsoft Office Suite) Strong desire to learn new industries and technologies Ability to adapt to new challenges Ability to prioritize tasks, work on multiple assignments, and manage ambiguity Ability to work both independently and as a part of a team with professionals at all levels Preferred Skills: Salesforce.com certification (Platform Developer) Experience working with modern MV* JavaScript frameworks (Angular, Backbone, Ember) Understanding of web design and related web services (particularly REST and SOAP) Required Experience: 3+ years working as a business consultant or technical liaison in an internal or external capacity 2+ years leading CRM system implementation efforts using an SDLC methodology Education: Bachelors of Science or Bachelors of Arts degree (Computer Science, Engineering or MIS preferred) Relevant product & technology certifications Learn more about our Careers:

items.content: Elevation Solutions focuses on education (Higher Ed and K-12), nonprofit, and provider healthcare organizations through the delivery of strategy and technology implementation services. If you are amazing with people, organized, efficient, and really into Salesforce.com we need you! Role ResponsibilitiesLead clients through strategic roadmapping and persona-based discovery initiatives, instilling a sense of partnership, trust, and understanding of the road aheadArchitect best-in-class technology solutions focused on the Salesforce ecosystem utilizing persona-based experience requirements as your guideDrive projects to completion while maintaining focus on and ensuring delivery of original objectives and quantitative results to be achievedManage all project team members, including marketing, build, data, development, and integration team membersCall out risks when they appear and craft plans to mitigate themManage the preparation and delivery of weekly client status reports and monthly project updatesSupport the company on internal initiatives from time-to-time RequirementsEducation, nonprofit, and/or healthcare industry experience nice but not requiredExperience creating strategic plans related to Salesforce.com development and implementations requiredProven experience as a management consultant on multiple Salesforce engagementsKnowledge of agile project delivery practices, persona-based requirements gathering, user story prioritization, and solid UAT guidelinesExcellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize workAttention to detail and problem solving skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsBachelor's degree required, MBA a plusSalesforce Administrator and one Consultant Certification is required Other things to know This job is for a full time position, 100% remote - work from home or coffee shops or wherever you like. We still have a lot of team interaction, though, so you won't be lonely. You will need an internet connection with bandwidth to support online video conferences. Work week is generally Monday-Friday and office hours are somewhat flexible. We mostly work between 8 and 5 MST (with reasonable adjustments based on time zone). We offer a flexible vacation policy, 401K enrollment, and the ability to participate in our health insurance plan. We do not allow side consulting work; you will need to focus 100% on our clients and growing business. Lastly, this role may require up to 25% travel based on client requirements.

items.content:
Pay Rate:?$17.00-$18.00 per hr.
REMOTE POSITION. We are looking for a candidate that resides in either the Sacramento CA or Fort Worth TX area.

The Junior Salesforce Admin is responsible for Salesforce Administrator duties for the organization as a part of the McClatchy Salesforce Success team, with a primary focus on providing end-user support.


Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Provide day to day end user support and assist users with best practices to improve and increase their knowledge of Salesforce.com
  • Create and manage users, profiles, roles and permission sets in Salesforce
  • Assist in developing reports, dashboards, and processes to continuously monitor data quality and integrity
  • Assist in data import/export/updates for managers and sales teams.
  • Troubleshoot Salesforce issues and escalate as needed
  • Assist with training end users on the use of Salesforce.com
  • Create training and user documentation, and maintain ongoing documentation processes as business needs evolve or features are added
  • Create training and user documentation, and maintain ongoing documentation processes as business needs evolve or features are added
  • Maintain data and system security and integrity in Salesforce
?Qualifications?and Preferred Skills:
  • 1+ years experience as a Salesforce Administrator and/or another sales CRM system
  • Saleforce.com Administrator Certification is a plus
  • Experience with APEX, APEX TRIGGERS, VISUALFORCE, HTML, JAVA, SQL, SOQL a plus
  • Bachelor?s Degree or equivalent related experience in business or technology
  • Proficient skills in Excel, Outlook, Word and Powerpoint
?

McClatchy, a national leader in digital media,?is growing rapidly in the digital space and delivering award-winning journalism in innovative ways. We are experiencing the most transformative period in our history.??Learn a little about us:?? This is McClatchy

items.content:
Sr. Salesforce CPQ Business Analyst - 100% Remote - $120k


A top client of ours is looking for a talented Senior Salesforce Business Systems Analyst with knowledge of Salesforce CPQ (Steelbrick). You would be joining a well-developed team at a company that just recently upgraded to an all SaaS based landscape. This is a techno-functional position revolving around all aspects of CPQ from both regenerating sales as well as driving new company growth!


Role & Responsibilities



  • Work with Sales and Renewals to understand business processes
  • Act as SME and point of contact for all things Salesforce CPQ related
  • Guide and assist the team with regression, UAT, and system integration testing for existing and new CPQ process
  • IT strategy and road-mapping to achieve company's goals


Skills & Qualifications



  • Experience with Salesforce and Salesforce Business Analysis
  • Knowledge of Salesforce CPQ
  • Hands on CPQ functionality
  • Salesforce Sales Cloud
  • Lead to Order process

Benefits



  • Full Time Benefits

items.content:
Senior Salesforce Developer - Overland Park, Kansas - Remote



An industry leading IT company is looking to bring in a Senior Salesforce Developer who is ready to make a difference. This role would serve as the technical lead for everything Salesforce at the organization. The position would also allow someone the diversity of work to not do the same mundane tasks every day. Build reliable code on some of the newest, cutting edge tools and platforms to increase operations efficiency. Be a part of a best-in-class organization using cutting-edge technology to drive business results.



Responsibilities in this role include:



  • Leveraging Salesforce to create solutions that translate into meeting business requirements
  • You will design and build high-performance reusable, and reliable Apex/Lightning code
  • Always work at the highest of standards
  • Completion of code-dependent actions and configuration with a high degree of efficiency and quality



Requirements for this role:



  • Understanding of the Salesforce product suite
  • Development experience using Visualforce, Apex Triggers, Apex Classes, and other programming languages
  • Ability to perform automated testing and write unit tests
  • Active Salesforce certifications or ability to achieve relevant certifications upon hire
  • Experience integrating with E-commerce products that sync data into Salesforce
  • Experience with JavaScript, JQuery, HTML5, and CSS3 preferred


Apply through this Ad or contact me at or (Ext 1405) to take advantage of this highly sought after opportunity!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Salesforce Lightning Developer - (Remote Role)

6+ Months

Job Responsibilities:

Salesforce Lightning Developer (8+ yrs experience, strong in Lightning, Service cloud, aura framework etc)

Description PURPOSE:

This position designs, develops, tests and implements business application solutions using the Salesforce platform tools and technologies. The scope of the applications will vary in size and complexity from department level to enterprise wide and may be internally focused within Andersen Corporation or externally focused to support a variety of customer channels.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the design, development, testing, deployment and documentation of applications
  • Work closely with business customers to understand, define and document business requirements, functional requirements and design requirements
  • Work closely with process owners in the design phase to leverage technology to support business process improvements
  • Design, development and testing methods and techniques must meet corporate IT standards as well as industry best practices
  • Work with IT infrastructure staff and PMO staff to ensure the successful delivery of the application
  • Accurately estimate the design, development, testing and deployment of the application
  • Completes comprehensive unit and system testing of application, its components and interfaces
  • Support and maintain applications from a customer and technology perspective
  • Support other application developers on technical issues and assisting with their development efforts
  • Research and develop skills in new technologies
  • Successfully provide direction and oversight to contracted external development vendors
  • Provide technical and user application documentation
  • Provide user training as required

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related discipline
  • Minimum of 8+ years of development experience with the Salesforce platform .
  • Experience implementing requirements on the Salesforce platform and Force.com IDE plug-in using Eclipse or, preferably, Welkin Suite
  • Experience developing complex Apex classes, controller classes, Apex triggers, and custom logic using Apex batch classes
  • Able to develop custom wizards using Visualforce pages and custom controllers
  • Experience writing custom formula fields and validation rules
  • Experience creating Visualforce pages, page layouts, custom links, related lists and other components
  • Lightning development experience particularly using Lightning Web Components is strongly desired
  • Experience with Salesforce sandbox testing and code migration
  • Experience with Salesforce communities
  • Ability to create and customize Salesforce dashboards
  • Experience using Git-based source control tools within a team
  • DevOps experience in a Salesforce environment is strongly desired
  • Experience with Field Service Lightning is strong desired
  • Salesforce developer certification is desired
  • Interact with team members to help gather and document requirements
  • Familiar with a variety of application development methodologies including SDLC, Agile and Scrum
  • Experience developing web applications that are customer facing
  • Experience with database technologies including SQL and Oracle
  • Able to work independently as well as in a team environment
  • Able to deliver high quality solutions
  • Able to manage and prioritize several tasks and projects
  • Strong problem-solving skills and able to generate creative solutions
  • Strong focus on customer service and goes the extra mile to ensure a positive customer experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Thanks & Regards,
Abdul
Sr. Technical Recruiter
Email:
Phone:

- provided by Dice

items.title: Oracle HCM Developer - Remote
items.content:
POSITION Oracle HCM Developer - Remote

LOCATION Tampa FL - Remote

DURATION 4+ Months (extendable 12+ month after)

REQUIRED SKILLS Must have Oracle HCM, and Fusion. Full JD below

Job Description:

Role provides advice and support for key client issues, using technology, data services and change management effectiveness skills to provide you with the best solution. Enterprise application services we provide include the following: Architecture: Rationalizing a portfolio of applications from integrated systems, best-of-breed solutions, and other software implemented over the years or inherited with mergers and acquisitions

  • Selection: Facilitating an objective, fact-based process to weigh the most viable options for integrated systems (e.g. ERP) and/or best-of-breed, point solutions
  • Implementation: Assessing, designing, developing, testing, deploying, and supporting Oracle and SAP system components to meet business requirements
  • Optimization: Assessing and redesigning processes in Oracle, SAP, or other leading ERP systems. Undergraduate Degree (e.g., BA, BS) preferred in computer science, information technology or a related discipline.

Demonstrates extensive abilities and/or a proven record of success in the following areas of application development:

-Learning rapidly and continuously taking advantage of new technologies, concepts, and business models;

-Demonstrating a history of staying current in emerging technology trends;

-Ability to engage effectively at the business and technical level, provide exceptional client service

-Using and applying robust analytic thinking with the ability to identify, debug, and resolve technical issues;

-Collaborating with multi-disciplinary teams in resolving complex technical issues;"

- provided by Dice

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Job Role: Salesforce Developer
Job Location: Stanford, CA (Remote role)
Job duration: Long-term

Description:

As a Salesforce Developer, you'll be a core member of the development team supporting our internal systems. While the SFDC platform will be your technical focus, you'll be willing and able to be relied on by leadership to discuss IT roadmap, provide feedback, and receive ideas from. Working closely with others on the tech teams, you'll build, test, iterate and deploy changes supporting technical maintenance, ongoing enhancements to existing features, and new functionality such as integrations, portal application modules, or automated business processes. You'll play a leading role in understanding end user interactions with SFDC apps and be able to put him/herself in their shoes. Must be a self-starter with the desire to stay in tune with industry direction on the use of BI/Analytics and SFDC usage best practices and industry standards. Needs to be able to adapt quickly and learn on the go, filling any gaps that may exist within his/her own knowledge and anticipated needs. The individual will be a right-hand to the Director and team leads and needs to have that spark that translates into a trusted thought leader.

Key Responsibilities:

Fix SFACT licensing automation issues.
Fix issue with SFACT visual force pages snapshot creation using Lightning. One year of direct hands-on experience with Lightning.
Mass data loads (for CRM and SFACT).
Collaboration on re-architecting Salesforce & Pardot to meet anti-spam regulations.
Auditing data within salesforce, automating reports to enable systematic cleanup.
Help mass cleanup effort of data.
Integration with ERP data.
ETL development to automate integration with ERP.
Integrating data with client systems using APIs.
Custom creation of event management system, research unmanaged Salesforce package.
Automate weekly encrypted backup of Salesforce data onto servers.
Implementing additional academic departments and programs in the client CRM Salesforce org.
Possible systems/data integration re-work.
Possible authority reporting development.
Execute deployments in a safe and documented way, helping to drive improved team deployment processes.
Participate in technical design discussions, influencing smart decisions about when to use configuration vs. coding.
Lead iterative feedback sessions, enabling the business to provide input on work in progress.
Troubleshoot escalated support issues - collecting data, performing analysis on root cause, and implementing short- and long-term solutions.
Function as tech lead on projects being implemented.
Mentor peers via code review and ad hoc assistance.
Learn and adapt to internal builder tools.

Thanks & Regards
SUNIT

- provided by Dice

items.title: Salesforce Developer | Remote | 12+Months _ SFDC
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=25, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=20, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Job Title: Salesforce Developer

Location: Remote

Duration: 12+Months

Job Description:

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

  • Works on projects that may span a broad range of systems. Requires expertise in multiple technical environments and possesses an increased level of business knowledge.
  • Responsibilities include, but may not be limited to, the following:
  • Consults in the project planning process with customers, IT business analysts, architects and team members.
  • Organizes and documents technical requirements. Creates technical design specifications and assists in sizing technical requirements.
  • Works with customers to develop and analyze application packages and tools and determine optimum functionality requirements to meet those needs. Evaluates new application packages and tools.
  • Provides multiple recommendations for the solutions.
  • Evaluates existing applications and platform and provides recommendations for system enhancements by conducting gap analysis, identifying feasible alternative solutions, and assisting in the scope of modifications.
  • Participates on teams that outline the process and scope out the improvements that can be realized through the application solution.
  • May lead the deployment of new modules, upgrades and fixes.
  • Implements integration plans. Interfaces with testing teams to incorporate plans into integration testing process.
  • Defines, develops or modifies software application modules or enterprise wide software systems using disciplined development processes.
  • Identifies better sources of data feeds and interfaces with architects to ensure their feasibility with corporate data warehouse, when needed.
  • Documents functions and changes to new or modified modules, test activities/results and other areas such as error handling and backup/recovery procedures.
  • Adheres to quality standards and procedures. Reviews modules for quality assurance and checks compliance with application architecture standards and SLAs.
  • May assist in defining development guidelines and standards to be utilized in software development/integration.
  • Makes modules production-ready by moving them to libraries, completing forms, following procedures, completing version control documents, etc.
  • Provides ongoing maintenance of applications.
  • May produce and analyze data extracts from system based on user requirements.
  • Assists in the development of user guides and training documentation.
  • Provides technical leadership coaching and mentoring to team members. Provides technical guidance or system process expertise.
  • Develops reports and presentations for senior management, as needed.
  • Developing Salesforce Apps and/or Community pages for assigned projects
  • Performing thorough Peer Code Review
  • Troubleshoot and solve Incident tickets
  • Perform critical review of User Stories and technical design alignment
  • Maintain adherence to Platform and Coding standards

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or business management and 7-10 years experience.
  • 4-6 years' experience as a hands-on developer and architect within the Salesforce domain with proven track record in delivering complex projects
  • Expertise creating and integrating Salesforce External Services, External Objects and use of Salesforce Connect using OData with internal APIs and micro-services
  • Experience with Release Management, Source Control, and Deployment concepts and technologies such as ANT, SFDC Metadata API, Jenkins, SVN
  • Development using VisualForce, APEX, triggers, Classes, Java Script, Lightning API.
  • Hands-on mobile development experience
  • Extensive experience programming and/or systems analysis experience. Have a broad level of understanding surrounding information systems and application architecture standards.
  • Perform development of customer enhancements, and maintenance tasks using expertise with SQL Server, Oracle, VB .Net, and SSRS.
  • Ability to work well under deadlines and in a flexible environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to perform all essential functions. (See above)
  • Must have leadership skills, experience/in-depth knowledge of business operations and systems requirements processes including ability to measure short- and long-term business goals.
  • Must possess the ability to utilize adaptable communication skills to effectively translate between technical and business language.
  • Must possess the skill to educate project team members on business unit goals and objectives and educate the business on the value of information technology.
  • Ability to identify, propose and oversee the execution of business solutions as well as interpret
  • documents communicating business needs and requirements.
  • Must possess the skill to assess the client needs through direct interaction, and identify opportunities to develop the business through effective use of technology.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

  • Willingness to support applications 24 x 7 (24 hours a day, 7 days a week)
  • The successful candidate will have proven experience with:
  • Service Cloud, Community Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Sales Cloud, Force.com
  • Role Based Access Control, and Permission Sets
  • Lightning Container, Lightning UX Builder
  • Lightning Flow including Process Builder and Cloud Flow Designer
  • Platform Events, Async REST, Sync REST, and Continuation Framework (integration)
  • Salesforce DX (dev hub)
  • Platform App Builder, Platform Developer, Data Architecture and Management Designer and Integration Architecture domains
  • Salesforce Visualforce, Apex, SOQL/SOSL
  • Wave and Einstein Analytics

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Salesforce Certified Advanced Administrator
  • Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I
  • Salesforce Certified Platform Developer II
  • Salesforce Certified App Builder
  • Salesforce Certified Advance Administrator
  • Salesforce Certified community consultant
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent communication skills - both oral and written
  • Background in transportation or logistics
  • Knowledge with Sencha 4 or higher
  • Knowledge with Java
  • Knowledge of Websphere

Please send us the resume s to ramesh(at)pcservicesinc(dot)com

- provided by Dice

items.content:
Salesforce Developer - Salesforce.com - 100% Remote- $130K + Bonus, Full Benefits


A well establish Salesforce end user in looking to hire a Salesforce Lead Developer to join their expanding and growing Salesforce team.


Role & Responsibilities:



  • Design and deploy new functionally and integrations follow Salesforce best practice
  • Work independently without supervision while leading a small team of Salesforce Developers and Administrators
  • Manage phases of systems implementations (configuration, customization, integration, data migration).
  • Testing, including defining/supporting user acceptance testing (UAT) and gathering feedback from pre-release testers .
  • Log, track, and manage issues, bugs, and enhancement/ features requests logged through JIRA.
  • Participate in on-going systems administration, maintenance, and support functions.
  • Follow and work within project work plans and timelines to meet changing needs and requirements.
  • Ensure consistency of specifications across sub-systems
  • Take part in the


Qualifications:



  • 4+ years of hands on Salesforce Development experience
  • Salesforce experience with Apex Classes, Apex Triggers, SOQL, or Visualforce.
  • Experience with web applications a strong plus: HTML, Javascript, XML, web services (SOAP or REST), APIs
  • Experience with SDLC
  • Debugging, Development, Documentation, and Testing
  • Strong proven analytical and problem solving abilities
  • Flexibility and attitude to achieve tight deadlines
  • Strong balance of business and technical skills and ability to communicate technical concepts clearly to non-technical teams and decision-makers.
  • Ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously and operate in a demanding work environment
  • Previous experience with marketing automation is a plus
  • Certifications are a plus


Salary is flexible depending upon experience. If you enjoy a fast-paced environment with the opportunity to gain skills in several areas and continue to grow as a Salesforce Developer then this is the position for you!



Please contact me at or send your resume to Zo @ to interview as soon as possible.



Mason Frank International is the global leader for Salesforce.com recruitment, advertising more Salesforce.com jobs than any other agency. We deal with both Salesforce.com Partners & End Users throughout North America. By specializing solely in placing candidates in the Salesforce.com market I have built relationships with most of the key employers in North America and have an unrivalled understanding of where the best opportunities and Salesforce.com jobs are.

items.content: Elevation Solutions focuses on education (Higher Ed and K-12), nonprofit, and provider healthcare organizations through the delivery of strategy and technology implementation services. If you are amazing with people, organized, efficient, and really into Salesforce.com we need you! Role ResponsibilitiesLead clients through strategic roadmapping and persona-based discovery initiatives, instilling a sense of partnership, trust, and understanding of the road aheadArchitect best-in-class technology solutions focused on the Salesforce ecosystem utilizing persona-based experience requirements as your guideDrive projects to completion while maintaining focus on and ensuring delivery of original objectives and quantitative results to be achievedManage all project team members, including marketing, build, data, development, and integration team membersCall out risks when they appear and craft plans to mitigate themManage the preparation and delivery of weekly client status reports and monthly project updatesSupport the company on internal initiatives from time-to-time RequirementsEducation, nonprofit, and/or healthcare industry experience nice but not requiredExperience creating strategic plans related to Salesforce.com development and implementations requiredProven experience as a management consultant on multiple Salesforce engagementsKnowledge of agile project delivery practices, persona-based requirements gathering, user story prioritization, and solid UAT guidelinesExcellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize workAttention to detail and problem solving skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsBachelor's degree required, MBA a plusSalesforce Administrator and one Consultant Certification is required Other things to know This job is for a full time position, 100% remote - work from home or coffee shops or wherever you like. We still have a lot of team interaction, though, so you won't be lonely. You will need an internet connection with bandwidth to support online video conferences. Work week is generally Monday-Friday and office hours are somewhat flexible. We mostly work between 8 and 5 MST (with reasonable adjustments based on time zone). We offer a flexible vacation policy, 401K enrollment, and the ability to participate in our health insurance plan. We do not allow side consulting work; you will need to focus 100% on our clients and growing business. Lastly, this role may require up to 25% travel based on client requirements.

items.content:
Georgia Institute of Technology

 

Application Developer II (salesforce)


US-only
**Job Purpose**: Perform intermediate level system analysis, definition and design activities often of a complex nature for new software applications. Modify and maintain existing applications. **Major Responsibilities**: * Consult with users, analyze requirements and recommend technical design and specifications. * Develop, test and implement technical solutions. * Modify and maintain existing applications. * Prepare technical, operational and user related documentation in support of applications. * Provide technical support and training to functional users * Perform other related duties as assigned. **Basic Qualifications**: *  **Education**: Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience *  **Work Experience**: Two to four years job related experience. *  **Certifications**: N/A *  **Skills**: This job requires working knowledge and skills in application of query language, web development tools, procedural development tools, relational databases, structured programming and understanding of the software development life cycle. **Qualifications** **Preferred Qualifications**: *  **Preferred Education**: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field is preferred *  **Preferred Work Experience**: 2 or more years of experience working within an agile team. 2 or more years of experience working with Salesforce or other CRM technologies. *  **Preferred Certifications**: Salesforce Platform Developer I or other Salesforce certifications *  **Preferred Skills**: * Experience and familiarity with these tools or frameworks are preferred:: * Lightning, Angular, React, or general JS experience * Apex, Java, C# .NET, or Python * MVC frameworks such as VisualForce or ASP .NET * git and GitHub or other similar version control tools * SOQL or any SQL variant * REST and SOAP API protocols * Integration tools such as Mulesoft, Zapier, Jitterbit, or Flow * Experience and familiarity with these best practices or methodologies is preferred: * Familiarity working in a CI/CD development environment * Experience with TDD and other software development best practices * Experience with SCRUM, Kanban, or other agile methodologies * Understanding of integration design patterns and best practices * Understanding of software design patterns and best practices **Additional Information**: The CRM Developer is responsible for designing, implementing, testing, and deploying CRM solutions (within the SalesForce.com environment) for Institute organizations. In addition to standard SFDC configuration, the CRM developer will be responsible for developing solutions that may leverage HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX, and other technologies. The CRM developer will be responsible for the customization and configuration of standard and non-standard components required to meet business requirements in a very high quality and using software development best practices such as TDD, Agile, version control, and CI/CD. The CRM Developer must be able to communicate well with academic and business units who have varying technical abilities, as well as with staff, contractors, and vendors. The ideal candidate will be eager to learn, have a knack for solving problems, and excited to develop innovative solutions to complex business problems. **Remote candidates will be considered**. **Impact & Influence**: This position will interact on a consistent basis with: Other software developers and analysts, project managers, customers and department management. This position typically will advise and counsel: NA. This position will supervise: NA. **Department Description**  The Salesforce team within the OIT EIS department is a new and rapidly growing team that is focused on bringing innovative solutions to tough business challenges across a variety of stakeholders throughout the Institute. Our team is entrepreneurial, innovative, and collaborative and we solve tough challenges head-on in a supportive and enjoyable working environment. The Office of Information Technology (OIT) provides information technology leadership and support to the Georgia Institute of Technology, working in partnership with academic and business units to meet the unique needs of a leading research university. OIT serves as the primary source of enterprise-wide information technology and telecommunications services in support of students, faculty, staff, and researchers. Services and resources range from operating and maintaining Georgia Tech's leading-edge wired and wireless networks, which provide Internet and research network connectivity, to protecting the integrity of the Institute’s data and critical administrative systems. The Enterprise Information Systems (EIS) Directorate is comprised of several key groups working cooperatively together to implement, enhance and support the strategic institute initiatives and projects related to Georgia Tech’s enterprise administrative/business and academic information systems. **Job**: Information Technology **Primary Location**: Georgia-Atlanta or Remote **Organization**: Office of (OIT) Information Technology **Job Posting**: Sep 4, 2019, 1:19:18 PM **Hiring Range**: N/A **Schedule**: Full-time #Salary $75000 #Location - US-only

Job description

Senior Salesforce Developer

Eagle Creek Software Services is a CRM, BI, and eCommerce services firm and the largest dedicated provider of on-shore and rural sourcing services in the US. Eagle Creek Software focuses on implementing, upgrading and extending the useful life of CRM, BI, and allied technologies. People are attracted to Eagle Creek for our focus; for our success, (rapid growth since 1999); for the opportunity to work on the largest and most innovative projects in the US with Fortune 1000 clients; and for our reputation for high quality. 

Duties

  • Participate in the development of  Salesforce applications based on client needs for integration, implementation, and customization projects
  • Mentor and train, formally and informally, Eagle Creek’s Jr. and mid-level resources
  • Foster and maintain development and integration standards, best practices and related deliverables with the EC team
  • Participate in pre-sales efforts and strategic project planning
  • Ability to travel for initial project set-up and major milestones as required
  • Additional duties as required

 Required Technical Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, related field, or equivalent
  • 3+ years experience with end to end Salesforce.com implementations, integrations, and enhancement projects
  • 2+ years APEX and VisualForce development for custom Salesforce functionality
  • Salesforce development certification (highly desired)
  • Hands-on development skills

 Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

Apply now

About Eagle Creek Software Services

Founded in 1999, Eagle Creek Software Services provides consulting and technical expertise to the Enterprise. We focus on CRM, Application Development, Data Integration and BI, helping our clients increase quality and efficiency while managing price and risk in software development, deployment and support.

We’re uniquely positioned by combining on site expertise with our U.S. Onshore delivery platforms. This model utilizes on shore but offsite, technology center based resources, in a model that we developed in collaboration with the state governments of North and South Dakota. Through this approach, we are able to achieve consistency and sustainability in the provisioning of technical and consulting capabilities to our clients.

With over 15 years in business and over 5 million hours of experience, Eagle Creek has expertise in a multitude of industries. From Hospitality to Manufacturing, we have the know-how to implement, upgrade or maintain your technology stack. But if you’re in need of a company with a special understanding, a deep industry expertise, we have that also. Some of the areas/sectors that we excel in include Healthcare, Insurance, Financial Services, Communications, Technology, and Life Sciences.

We’re committed to delivering a technology value proposition that positively impacts our customer and to helping you sustain your front office technology investments. Simply stated, you want the highest quality of services, at the most affordable price, where risk is continuously assessed and mitigated. With all of our years of experience we only know one way to achieve this, and that’s through U.S. Onshore. Nine years ago, when everyone was building offshore facilities, we were investing in U.S. Onshore. Today, we are the innovation leader supporting over 40 different technologies, applications and platforms. CRM, Application Development, BI – Salesforce®, Oracle, Birst, Cognos, Informatica, Java, .NET and Drupal – depth of expertise and breadth of experience.

We’re Eagle Creek – the innovative leader in U.S. Onshore.

If you would enjoy working in a dynamic environment and are looking for an opportunity to become part of a stellar team of professionals, we invite you to apply online today. 

Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to sex, race, age, disability, religion, national origin, color or any other protected class.

Benefits

  • Medical
  • PTO
  • Career Development
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • 401K
  • Life Insurance
  • Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance
  • Passionate Teammates

Job description

I am looking for a solid Salesforce architect to help me evaluate options to upgrade a customer's Salesforce installation to Lightning. This will involve prototyping screens in Saleforce using Lightning components and potentially custom lightning components. Work would be for 2 months at 20 hours a week, starting at the end of September 2019. Could easily carry on for another 8-9 months after that (or you can choose to just do the first 2 months, which are guaranteed). 

1) Must have a software development background
2) Must have done Lightning component-based development in Salesforce
3) Understands Salesforce in-depth, comfortable with identifying Salesforce packages on the marketplace and integrating these
4) Understands good solid Salesforce design, including proper data modeling

Ideally also has used Heroku Connect to integrate Salesforce with a custom web application.

    Please detail your qualifications with the 4 must-have's listed in the posting Have you ever set up or used Heroku Connect? If so, please provide details as to what you did towards this Will you be able to commit to up to 20 hours a week with predictable hours each day e.g. a block of time each day where we can work together?
Apply now

We build enterprise business & SaaS web applications for start-up companies to Fortune 500 companies.

salesforce

Job description

POSITION OVERVIEWXapo is a fast-growing, global fintech company with a mission to build a safe and global way to use money. We’re a fully distributed team, with 250+ Xapiens working from 50+ countries. We’re seeking a collaborative, proactive problem-solver to join us as Salesforce Developer at Xapo. This full-time position is planned to be remote, meaning you can work from anywhere!In this role, you will be responsible for owning and customizing our internal Salesforce platform.The ideal candidate is comfortable taking on ownership in a highly technical environment, resourceful, self-motivated, and passionate about understanding and fulfilling their client’s business requirements.BALANCE FOR BETTERAt Xapo, we embrace our differences and actively foster an inclusive environment where we all can thrive. We’re a flexible, family-friendly environment, and we recognize that everyone has commitments outside of work. We have a goal of reaching gender parity and strongly encourage women to apply to our open positions. Diversity is not a tagline at Xapo; it is our foundation.RESPONSIBILITIES
    Develop, enhance, test, support, maintain and debug software applications that support business units or support functions.Work with internal teams to identify requirements and maintain a development schedule.Analyze/identify gaps in functional/business requirements, discuss required changes with product owners to align with Salesforce product stack and architecture.Develop end to end Salesforce solutions using Apex Class, Triggers, Visualforce pages, Lightning components etc.Write technical approach and design documentation as required.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
    5+ years as a software developer.Knowledge of product development lifecycle.Knowledge of DevOps tools like GIT, Jenkins, JIRA etc.Hands-on development experience using Salesforce configuration and customizations using Apex, triggers, etc.,Experience defining/working with REST APIsOral and written proficiency in English.
PREFERRED SKILLS
    Web development skills.Python language.Scrum experience.Amazon Web Services.Remote work experience.
OTHER REQUIREMENTS
    A dedicated workspace. A reliable internet connection with the fastest speed possible in your area.Devices and other essential equipment that meet minimal technical specifications.Alignment with Our Values.
WHY WORK FOR XAPO?
    Shape the Future: Improve lives through cutting-edge technology, work remotely from anywhere in the worldOwn Your Success: Receive attractive remuneration, enjoy an autonomous work culture and flexible hours, apply your expertise to meaningful work every dayExpect Excellence: Collaborate, learn, and grow with a high-performance team
ABOUT XAPOAt Xapo, we’re building a way for users all over the world to send, receive, spend, and store their money globally and safely. We're firm believers that no matter who you are or where you're from, you deserve easy access to digital financial services. Launched in 2014 by Wences Casares (CEO) & Federico Murrone (COO), Xapo has made an unparalleled investment in security infrastructure, assembled a renowned advisory board, and raised $40M from top venture capital firms in Silicon Valley & the world.Xapo is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe a team that represents a variety of backgrounds and perspectives is critical to our success as a global company. A diverse, inclusive workplace enables us to create products that best serve our customers all around the world. It is the foundation of Xapo.
Apply now

Benefits

  • Attractive compensation & equity opportunities
  • Remote job - work from anywhere in the world!
  • Flexible working hours
  • Autonomous work environment
  • Generous vacation plan
  • Paid leave for new parents
  • Collaborate with a global team across 50 countries!

About this job

Role: Backend Developer
Industry: eCommerce
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

java
hybris
progressive-web-apps
spring

Job description

„Wir verstehen unsere Unternehmung als Ort, an dem Menschen zusammenkommen, um ein starkes gemeinsames Interesse und gemeinsame Werte zu teilen.“
Smart Commerce SE ist ein innovativer Anbieter von eCommerce-Lösungen. Unseren Erfolg verdanken wir in erster Linie unseren Mitarbeitern, die in Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden maßgeschneiderte eCommerce-Lösungen für den Online-Handel planen, bauen und betreiben.

Wir suchen ab sofort für unsere Standorte in Leipzig, Stuttgart Böblingen und Jena oder remote:

(Senior) SAP-Commerce-Cloud-Entwickler ehem. Hybris (m/w/d)

Du bearbeitest, eingebunden in ein interdisziplinäres Team, kontinuierlich bestehende und neue eCommerce Projekte inhouse sowie vor Ort bei unseren Kunden.

Deine Aufgaben:

  • Du entwickelst und wartest kundenspezifische Erweiterungen von SAP Commerce Cloud (ehem. Hybris) Installationen
  • Du machst Aufwandsschätzungen und definierst Arbeitspakete auf Basis vorliegender Anpassungen
  • Du führst technische Dienstleistungspakete durch
  • Du konfigurierst Entwicklungsumgebungen und CI-Systeme
  • Du erstellst technische Spezifikationen
  • In deine Verantwortung fallen ebenfalls objektorientierte Analyse, Design und Entwicklung
  • Abhängig von deinen Erfahrungen, die du mitbringst, führst du ggf.  ein Team von qualifizierten Softwareentwicklern und übernimmst die technische

Dein Profil:

  • Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare technische Qualifikation
  • Du bringst Berufserfahrung als Java-Softwareentwickler und Knowhow in IT-Architekturen mit
  • Du hast einschlägige Erfahrungen mit SAP Commerce Cloud B2C & B2B Commerce Kundenprojekten
  • Du bringst als Voraussetzung auch Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung mit Java Spring & J2EE mit
  • Auch hast du Kenntnisse in Commerce-Cloud-Accelerator oder in der Anbindung von SAP Commerce Cloud an SAP
  • Deine Deutsch- und möglichst auch Englischkenntnisse sind sehr gut in Wort und Schrift

Unser Angebot:

  • Individuell entwickeltes Weiterbildungsprogramm
  • Unternehmensbeteiligungen und Mitbestimmung bis in die höchste Unternehmensebene
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Möglichkeit zum Homeoffice
  • Teilzeitarbeitsmodelle für deine Work-Life-Balance
  • Lebensarbeitszeitkonto für Sabbaticals o.ä.
  • Individuelle Haustierlösungen
  • Arbeitsumgebung auf dem aktuellsten Stand der Technik
  • Ein sympathisches Team und Vorgesetze, die sich auf deine Ideen freuen
  • Regelmäßige Teamevents
  • Konsequente Anerkennung von Leistungen,
  • Beiträgen und Erfolgen
  • Innovative Projekte, unbürokratische Strukturen und kurze Entscheidungswege

Das erwartet dich:

The “Smart Way” - Gegenseitiges Vertrauen, Offenheit und Ehrlichkeit, Teamarbeit, die Verpflichtung zu Qualität und Exzellenz, Unabhängigkeit und Mitbestimmung sind feste Bestandteile des Smart Way. Diese Werte leiten unsere Mitarbeiter bei der Umsetzung der Unternehmensziele. Der Smart Way definiert wer wir sind und wie wir arbeiten, denken und handeln – er differenziert Smart Commerce am Markt und macht uns zu einem innovativen und besonderen Arbeitgeber.

Du hast Fragen? Unter 03641-3161030 beantwortet dir Evelin Linde, unsere HR Managerin, diese gerne!

Neugierig geworden? Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung mit Angabe deines Gehaltswunsches und deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

Du hast Interesse an der Stelle aber gerade keine Zeit für eine ausführliche Bewerbung? Kein Problem, Lass dich anrufen!

Apply now

Benefits

  • Individuell entwickeltes Weiterbildungsprogramm
  • Unternehmensbeteiligungen und Mitbestimmung über Unternehmensaktien
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Möglichkeit zum Homeoffice
  • Teilzeitarbeitsmodelle für deine Work-Life-Balance
  • Lebensarbeitszeitkonto für Sabbaticals o.ä.

The successful applicant will play a vital role in the extension of Dynamics 365 (CE). This involves the development of custom plugins, portal's and modern web to facilitate wider IT infrastructure. Hosted in IOT -you will also gain commercial experience with Artificial Intelligence.

This Inner Circle MS Gold Partner is offering remote working for technically adapt applicants who have a proven track record in working to tight deadlines in a pressured environment.

On receipt of this - you and can expect industry leading training with opportunity to enhance professional background through MS certifications.

This is a salaried position paying £70,000 with a home based contract, personal development plan and company phone/laptop.

You will also receive benefits such as 8% contributory pension, 10% Personal Performance bonus and 26+stat days annual leave.

MS Dynamics CRM development experience (3+ Years).
Technical skill set of C#, asp.NET and JavaScript.
Experience in developing custom plugins to extend the platform.
Experience with TDD/an ability to build.
Full life cycle project experience.Desirable;

Experience with Modern Web/Portal work.
Experience with React/Angular JS.
Experience with integrated systems.To apply please send your CV to (url removed) or call Rosie Harkness on (phone number removed) with complete confidence, ASAP.

Senior Salesforce Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time

Industry: Consulting, Information Technology, IT Consulting
Company size: 201–500 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

web-services
salesforce
apex

Job description

Senior Salesforce Developer

Eagle Creek Software Services is a CRM, BI, and eCommerce services firm and the largest dedicated provider of on-shore and rural sourcing services in the US. Eagle Creek Software focuses on implementing, upgrading and extending the useful life of CRM, BI, and allied technologies. People are attracted to Eagle Creek for our focus; for our success, (rapid growth since 1999); for the opportunity to work on the largest and most innovative projects in the US with Fortune 1000 clients; and for our reputation for high quality. 

Duties

  • Participate in the development of  Salesforce applications based on client needs for integration, implementation, and customization projects
  • Mentor and train, formally and informally, Eagle Creek’s Jr. and mid-level resources
  • Foster and maintain development and integration standards, best practices and related deliverables with the EC team
  • Participate in pre-sales efforts and strategic project planning
  • Ability to travel for initial project set-up and major milestones as required
  • Additional duties as required

 Required Technical Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, related field, or equivalent
  • 3+ years experience with end to end Salesforce.com implementations, integrations, and enhancement projects
  • 2+ years APEX and VisualForce development for custom Salesforce functionality
  • Salesforce development certification (highly desired)
  • Hands-on development skills

 Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

Apply now

About Eagle Creek Software Services

Founded in 1999, Eagle Creek Software Services provides consulting and technical expertise to the Enterprise. We focus on CRM, Application Development, Data Integration and BI, helping our clients increase quality and efficiency while managing price and risk in software development, deployment and support.

We’re uniquely positioned by combining on site expertise with our U.S. Onshore delivery platforms. This model utilizes on shore but offsite, technology center based resources, in a model that we developed in collaboration with the state governments of North and South Dakota. Through this approach, we are able to achieve consistency and sustainability in the provisioning of technical and consulting capabilities to our clients.

With over 15 years in business and over 5 million hours of experience, Eagle Creek has expertise in a multitude of industries. From Hospitality to Manufacturing, we have the know-how to implement, upgrade or maintain your technology stack. But if you’re in need of a company with a special understanding, a deep industry expertise, we have that also. Some of the areas/sectors that we excel in include Healthcare, Insurance, Financial Services, Communications, Technology, and Life Sciences.

We’re committed to delivering a technology value proposition that positively impacts our customer and to helping you sustain your front office technology investments. Simply stated, you want the highest quality of services, at the most affordable price, where risk is continuously assessed and mitigated. With all of our years of experience we only know one way to achieve this, and that’s through U.S. Onshore. Nine years ago, when everyone was building offshore facilities, we were investing in U.S. Onshore. Today, we are the innovation leader supporting over 40 different technologies, applications and platforms. CRM, Application Development, BI – Salesforce®, Oracle, Birst, Cognos, Informatica, Java, .NET and Drupal – depth of expertise and breadth of experience.

We’re Eagle Creek – the innovative leader in U.S. Onshore.

If you would enjoy working in a dynamic environment and are looking for an opportunity to become part of a stellar team of professionals, we invite you to apply online today. 

Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to sex, race, age, disability, religion, national origin, color or any other protected class.

Benefits

  • Medical
  • PTO
  • Career Development
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • 401K
  • Life Insurance
  • Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance
  • Passionate Teammates

items.content:
Job Description

J2 Interactive is looking for qualified candidates to help us build creative and innovative solutions for our clients using the Salesforce platform. Since 2007, J2 Interactive has been delivering custom applications and large-scale health information exchange implementations for local RHIOs, statewide exchanges, and private health systems. As our team continues to expand the breadth of its service offerings, we're looking for talented, experienced software developers and interoperability experts who bring a knowledge of (or at least, a strong interest in) healthcare as well as deep experience with Salesforce integration and application development.

Though our headquarters is located in Charlestown (Boston), MA, this is a telecommuting position open to anyone who's eligible to work in the US.

Candidates must be willing to submit to a background check. No recruiters or third party solicitations please.

Skills Description

The ideal candidate will be a Solution Architect who has hands-on experience building solutions on the Salesforce.com platform. Desired credentials include:

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills; ability to work directly with clients.
  • In-depth understanding of Salesforce.com's Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Force.com product offerings. Bonus for Health Cloud experience.
  • 5+ years' experience writing Apex, Visualforce pages, S-controls and triggers in the Force.com development environment.
  • A track record in design and development of solutions that connect customers' data with the Salesforce platform and intimate familiarity with the capabilities of the Salesforce web service API.
  • Experience provisioning and administering Salesforce environments in a production setting.
  • A strong background in mobile app and web development including fluency in multiple mainstream programming languages (Java, Javascript, C#, SQL, HTML, HTML5). Knowledge of how to best leverage the tools, frameworks and APIs used to build apps for different devices.
  • Active Salesforce Certifications are desirable.

We're especially looking for people with experience in the U.S. healthcare industry and/or the InterSystems technology platform (Caché/Ensemble/HealthShare), but neither of those things are strictly necessary. The right person will be able to pick things up as long as they have the motivation.

Company Description

J2 Interactive is an award-winning software development and IT consulting firm specializing in customized solutions for hospitals, labs, research institutions, and health information exchanges. Our approach to design and development is rooted in a fundamental belief that systems succeed or fail based on how well they serve the people who depend upon them. For our clients in the healthcare industry, that includes doctors, nurses, technicians, and administrative staff ... but ultimately, it means patients and their families. At J2 we get a lot of satisfaction out of helping our customers succeed, and we want people with that same commitment to getting the job done right. We're not afraid to give people the responsibility of working directly with clients, defining project specs, and choosing implementation strategies. Our casual work environment and telecommuting options give our staff a high quality of life to go along with the technical and creative challenges of the work itself.

Benefits for full-time employees include:

  • The ability to telecommute from your home office

  • Minimal travel on most projects

  • Aggressive employee profit-sharing program

  • Voluntary 401(k) plan with company matching up to 4% of salary

  • Medical, dental and vision insurance, with 50% of costs paid by J2

  • J2 Flex Spending Account to pay for medical expenses on a pre-tax basis

  • Short-term and long-term disability insurance, paid for by J2

  • Laptop and required software

  • Annual ski trip that will make you wonder how you found this awesome company

If you're interested in joining our team, we invite you to submit your resume so we can take a look. We move fast ... so if you've got what we're looking for, you'll be amazed at how quickly you might have yourself a new job that you'll love.

J2 Privacy Policy

- provided by Dice

items.content:
Salesforce Administrator

ReUp Education is seeking a skilled Salesforce Admin / Product Manager to own the continued development and maintenance of our internal Coaching and Sales Platforms. These platforms have been key in helping us re-enroll thousands of students, and now is the perfect time for a Salesforce expert to take ownership, prioritize and manage new features, and optimize our platforms in partnership with teams across the organization. By helping us iterate and innovate on our core technologies, you’ll enable ReUp to achieve our ambitious goal of re-enrolling millions of college students and supporting them through to graduation. 

This is an incredible opportunity to play a meaningful role in a growing early-stage startup as we tackle a huge problem that affects a largely underserved population. You will be an integral part in ensuring the rest of our teams can put their time where it matters most to serve our students effectively. If you’re interested in using the power of data, technology, and coaching to transform people’s lives, come join us!

Responsibilities - Salesforce Admin
  • Support internal teams with Salesforce instance configuration, including: creating objects, fields, formula fields, validation rules, workflows, process builder, page layouts, etc.
  • Manage third-party integrations and vendor relationships
  • Proactively evaluate new releases of Salesforce and communicate recommendations appropriately
  • Gather requirements, scope, and execute (or manage) custom Salesforce development projects as needed (e.g. triggers, Apex, flows, custom objects, etc.)
  • Monitor, manage, and coordinate deployments across Salesforce environments
  • Perform data cleanup and data manipulation tasks using Data Loader as needed
  • Log and track identified system problems and work with support teams as needed
  • Manage security related to profiles, permission sets, roles, sharing settings and access policies, in collaboration with the Data team
  • Manage all users and licenses across instances (Coaching and Sales)
Responsibilities - Product Management
  • Work closely with our Head of Product, Head of Coaching Services, and other internal stakeholders as needed
  • Serve as product owner for our Coaching Platform, overseeing the full product lifecycle from discovery > design > dev > testing > deployment > measurement
  • Document user stories, technical requirements, and acceptance criteria
  • Manage the product backlog, plan for upcoming sprints, and run weekly scrum meetings
  • Oversee the continued development of proprietary backend services that integrate into the Coaching Platform
  • Contribute data-informed recommendations to the vision and strategy
Responsibilities - Other
  • Daily support of the Coaching Team and Sales Team in developing and managing their dashboards, reports, listviews, fields, and automations
  • Standardizing the structure and use of reports, dashboards, listviews, email templates, and workflows across instances to enable replicable results
  • Manage all incoming technical issues through ticketing system and Slack
Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in business or technology, or equivalent industry experience
  • Certified Salesforce Administrator with 2-5 years configuration experience; Salesforce developer experience is a big plus
  • Familiarity with agile software development
  • Prior product management experience a plus, but we can provide extensive training here
  • You have stellar communication skills and are able to collaborate with colleagues across departments and geographic locations
  • You are an excellent problem solver and decision-maker
  • You can prioritize multiple projects and competing work demands
  • You are comfortable digging into data and performing analyses
  • You are effective in presenting information across mediums and audiences
  • You have a strong sense of agency and internal drive to accomplish your goals
  • You are intellectually curious and love to learn
  • You are passionate about education and startups (higher ed, ed tech and/or startup experience a big plus)
  • You care about ReUp’s mission and are committed to helping us open new opportunities to students
  • Experience working remotely a plus
Compensation & Benefits
  • Competitive salary (commensurate with experience and location)
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees; we pay 100% of the employee's premium and 50% of any dependents' premiums
  • Flexible time off and remote work opportunity
  • 401(k) plan
  • A diverse team that fosters a high level of collaboration despite being highly distributed
  • We provide your choice of a Mac or PC laptop

items.content:
Salesforce B2B Commerce Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Frontend Developer, Full Stack Developer
Industry: B2B, Technology Consulting
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: 6 Street Technologies, LLC | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

salesforce
apex
visualforce
javascript
salesforce-lightning

Job description

6 Street Tech. has been developing cutting edge Salesforce B2B Commerce storefronts for our customers before CloudCraze was acquired. For the past 7 years (since 2012) 6Street has been using the newest technologies on the Salesforce platform to create these B2B Commerce sites and providing incredible value back to our customers. We are a fast paced, enthusiastic team that is growing by leaps and bounds!

We are looking for developers who love solving problems, using new technologies, and working directly with customers. We are a laid back but tight knit group who thrive working in a 100% remote environment. There's flexibility, and it's an opportunity to get in on the ground floor.

You'll be working with solution architects, technical architects, and developers on numerous projects. The work is fast paced, challenging, and rewarding. We aim to mentor and grow our developers to become leaders in the organization so there will be no shortage of opportunities.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Works effectively individually but also can collaborate with 6 Street Technologies and with customer team members toward customer satisfaction and success
  • Takes direction from project team members and immediate supervisor, but takes initiative and shows leadership when appropriate
  • Is able to exercise independent judgment on medium-sized, large, and enterprise engagements, or take a lead role on key components of a larger project.
  • Demonstrates the ability to perform Salesforce.com administration / configuration / data migration / integration duties as directed.

Skills & Requirements

MUST HAVE:

  • 3+ years experience with Visualforce/Apex coding on the Force.com platform
  • 2+ years experience with Salesforce administration
  • 2+ years experience HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Ajax, JQuery
  • Ability to work independently
  • Ability to learn quickly and think creatively
  • Willingness to jump in on multiple projects when necessary

NICE TO HAVE:

  • Salesforce Developer Certification such as Salesforce Platform Developer 1, Platform Developer 2, etc.
  • Salesforce Lightning component development experience
  • Backbone.js or AngularJS 1 experience
  • Handlebars experience
  • Experience with git
  • 2+ years of experience with Web Application Development utilizing technologies such as Java, .NET, Web Services
Apply now

About 6 Street Technologies, LLC

Come work at a place where all your achievements are noticed and appreciated. Our team is strong and business is booming in the Salesforce B2B Commerce space. Be a part of something being built from the ground up.

Work on important, industry changing projects. Several projects we have collaborated on have been featured in Dreamforce keynotes!

6Street. is a company where you get to work with the newest technologies in the Salesforce ecosystem. Our partners depend on us to provide a rewarding customer experience not only from our solutions but from us.

Benefits

  • Work from home
  • Employer-Sponsored 401(k) and Profit Sharing Plan
  • Flexible paid-time-off
  • Flexible health insurance options including dental and vision
  • Wellness program encouraging healthy living
  • Basic life, AD&D, short/long term disability, voluntary life insurance

items.title: Salesforce Architect (Remote)
items.content:
Stefanini is hiring!

We are hiring a Salesforce Marketing Cloud Architect who will be responsible for delivering high quality technical work, including setup, code, configuration, and validation, to enable a large-scale, complex implementation of the Salesforce Marketing Cloud. The person in this role MUST have extensive Marketing Cloud development and implementation experience, and be able to confidently design & enable complexities beyond a simple CRM connection - for example, multi-org connections, conflicting visibility requirements when connecting to a Salesforce CRM system, roles, sharing & visibility in CRM and their effects on marketing, migration from other marketing systems, etc.

Responsibilities:

The role is comprised of two main elements: technical design & development, in collaboration with the lead technical architect and functional/business team members, and completion of configuration and development efforts in a timely and effective manner, while working with other US-based and offshore development team members.

This implementation of the Marketing Cloud will be completed in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with multiple stakeholders, an international virtual team, and a tight series of deadlines; this role must be collaborative, a self-starter and team player, who can help drive the team to succeed and who is willing to pitch in wherever necessary to help the team get to done.

Attend daily Agile standups and provide concise updates regarding completed effort and any blockers or concerns

Quickly come up to speed on a large and complex multinational Salesforce CRM implementation, to best advise on Marketing Cloud design & setup needs

Complete setup of environment, connection to CRM, configuration of business units & other critical Marketing Cloud functionality, development **in both the CRM and the Marketing systems** to enable required business outcome

Join selected meetings with business users to understand requirements

Interface with other technical teams, information security, to clearly and articulately present technical designs for review and approval

Interface with US-based and offshore team members, with clean handoffs of code & other responsibilities, to ensure effective development

Document architectural designs

Salesforce enterprise-scale architectural design and application delivery;

Established SDLC methodologies including agile, scrum;

Robust analytical thinking skills with the ability to identify, debug and resolve technical issues;

Architectural domain knowledge including cloud application architecture and container-based deployment;

Business acumen that can interpret and translate goals into technical specifications, delivering thought leadership of specific technologies and driving technology change;

Business knowledge and interpersonal skills to build, maintain and influence relationships with key stakeholders.

Collaborating with other Architects and Developers to provide technical design guidance to align with firm strategy and applicable technical standards;

Working independently to evaluate and make strategic decisions that will address specific technology design needs;

Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams in resolving complex technical issues; providing design guidance that follows the enterprise architecture vision and adheres to applicable application technology guidelines; and mitigating the impact of technical design to security, performance and data privacy;

Participating in application solutions including assisting with planning and architectural design, hands-on development, resolution of technical issues

5+ years experience in software development life cycle

5+ year experience in Salesforce development and implementing Marketing systems

3+ years experience with Exact Target/Salesforce Marketing Cloud

Salesforce Administrator certification, Salesforce Developer Certification, and Marketing Cloud Consultant certification

Ability to work with a large project (experience required) and excellent communication skills are required in order to work well with the business and team.

Essential skills:

Knowledge of Salesforce execution flow, governor limits, design limitations;

Experience with design & hands-on coding of Cloud Pages and AMPscipt;

Knowledge or exposure to Marketing Cloud Connect Integration;

Experience working with Multiple Business Units in Marketing Cloud;

Deep understanding of Salesforce security;

Experience with Salesforce REST APIs and Postman;

Expert level understanding of the Salesforce Sales and Marketing Cloud solutions, as well as the Force.com Platform;

Experience with Salesforce Development and general salesforce components such as objects, fields, workflow rules, field updates, process builder, apex classes, triggers, test classes, etc;

Must be strong in various Marketing Cloud areas - Email Studio, Automation Studio, Mobile Studio, Journey Builder, MC Connect, Audience Builder, Data Extensions, etc.;

Familiarity with integrations using Marketing Cloud API

Education Required: Minimum Bachelor s degree - preferred in Computer Science or related field, but not required / Graduate degree preferred (or equivalent qualification)

Interested applicants may click the apply button or you may call us at for faster processing. Thank you.
- provided by Dice

Remote NetSuite Developer in San Diego, CA $70/hour

Our client is looking for a developer that can help with customizing their NetSuite mobile application. This client is exclusive to us and provides applicants with the ability to grow their NetSuite experience and knowledge. All candidates with NetSuite development experience are encouraged to send their resume as other roles may become available in the near future.

  • NetSuite experience
  • Experience with the NetSuite mobile application
  • Proficient in SuiteScript
The Role:

items.title: Salesforce Developer
items.content:
Xapo

Salesforce Developer

POSITION OVERVIEW Xapo is a fast-growing, global fintech company with a mission to build a safe and global way to use money. We’re a fully distributed team, with 250+ Xapiens working from 50+ countries.  We’re seeking a collaborative, proactive problem-solver to join us as Salesforce Developer at Xapo. This full-time position is planned to be remote, meaning you can work from anywhere! In this role, you will be responsible for owning and customizing our internal Salesforce platform. The ideal candidate is comfortable taking on ownership in a highly technical environment, resourceful, self-motivated, and passionate about understanding and fulfilling their client’s business requirements. BALANCE FOR BETTER At Xapo, we embrace our differences and actively foster an inclusive environment where we all can thrive. We’re a flexible, family-friendly environment, and we recognize that everyone has commitments outside of work. We have a goal of reaching gender parity and strongly encourage women to apply to our open positions. Diversity is not a tagline at Xapo; it is our foundation. RESPONSIBILITIES Develop, enhance, test, support, maintain and debug software applications that support business units or support functions. Work with internal teams to identify requirements and maintain a development schedule. Analyze/identify gaps in functional/business requirements, discuss required changes with product owners to align with Salesforce product stack and architecture. Develop end to end Salesforce solutions using Apex Class, Triggers, Visualforce pages, Lightning components etc. Write technical approach and design documentation as required. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS 5+ years as a software developer. Knowledge of product development lifecycle. Knowledge of DevOps tools like GIT, Jenkins, JIRA etc. Hands-on development experience using Salesforce configuration and customizations using Apex, triggers, etc., Experience defining/working with REST APIs Oral and written proficiency in English. PREFERRED SKILLS Web development skills. Python language. Scrum experience. Amazon Web Services. Remote work experience. OTHER REQUIREMENTS A dedicated workspace.  A reliable internet connection with the fastest speed possible in your area. Devices and other essential equipment that meet minimal technical specifications. Alignment with Our Values. WHY WORK FOR XAPO? Shape the Future: Improve lives through cutting-edge technology, work remotely from anywhere in the world Own Your Success: Receive attractive remuneration, enjoy an autonomous work culture and flexible hours, apply your expertise to meaningful work every day Expect Excellence: Collaborate, learn, and grow with a high-performance team ABOUT XAPO At Xapo, we’re building a way for users all over the world to send, receive, spend, and store their money globally and safely. We're firm believers that no matter who you are or where you're from, you deserve easy access to digital financial services.  Launched in 2014 by Wences Casares (CEO) & Federico Murrone (COO), Xapo has made an unparalleled investment in security infrastructure, assembled a renowned advisory board, and raised $40M from top venture capital firms in Silicon Valley & the world. Xapo is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe a team that represents a variety of backgrounds and perspectives is critical to our success as a global company. A diverse, inclusive workplace enables us to create products that best serve our customers all around the world. It is the foundation of Xapo.
