tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=8, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
SAP4HANA Integration Developer to design, develop, test and implement SAP4HANA outbound data integration with the BOS R&A Azure based solution. This role will utilize the latest SAP4HANA technologies and other various software/middleware components. Role will collaborate with end-users, analysts, and developers to identify requirements for enterprise data connectivity solutions (integrations, interfaces, proxies, objects, shared code library, etc.) with SAP4HANA focus. - U.S Citizens and GC Only

Required Skills and Experience::
  • A bachelor's degree (or higher) or foreign equivalent degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or a related field.
  • Experience with integrating SAP4HANA data with an Enterprise Reporting environment in batch and near real time use cases
  • Experience in middleware and enterprise integration including XML/XSLT, Data Transformation, Integration Infrastructure and Web Services (REST/JSON, SOAP/WSDL)
  • Good understanding of XML, SOAP, WSDL, XSD, UDDI, REST, ODATA API's.
  • Experience with any of the following:
    • Should have worked with creating and consuming web services, REST API's.
    • Integration Platform and tools - SAP Process Integration (PI/PO), webMethods, SAP ALE, SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI)
    • Experience with Cloud iPaaS platforms, custom API development and the ability to pick up new technical knowledge quickly
    • SAP HANA, SAP UI5, Core Data Services (CDS), Business Objects Processing Framework (BOPF), OData services using Netweaver Gateway.
    • Experience working with Microsoft Azure architecture and components, including SAP4 HANA Integration with Microsoft Azure
  • Experience working with relational databases, data modeling and SQL scripting.
  • Ability to design, develop, document, and support enterprise solutions utilizing design patterns, reference architectures, and best practices.
Desired Skills and Experience:
  • Actual hands on SAP4HANA data integration implementation experience
  • Ability to communicate complex technical concepts in an effective manner to a wide audience of non-technical stakeholders
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish strong cross-organizational partnerships.
  • Experienced with development & integration, supporting multifaceted Cloud and on-premise applications and systems environment.

items.content:
Salesforce Developer at Xapo

Remote | Freelance | International

BO Product Management – Anywhere, Anywhere

  • Location: Anywhere, Anywhere
  • Department: BO Product Management
  • Employment Type: Consultant
  • Minimum Experience: Experienced

POSITION OVERVIEW

Xapo is a fast-growing, global fintech company with a mission to build a safe and global way to use money. We’re a fully distributed team, with 250+ Xapiens working from 50+ countries.

We’re seeking a collaborative, proactive problem-solver to join us as Salesforce Developer at Xapo. This full-time position is planned to be remote, meaning you can work from anywhere!

In this role, you will be responsible for owning and customizing our internal Salesforce platform.

The ideal candidate is comfortable taking on ownership in a highly technical environment, resourceful, self-motivated, and passionate about understanding and fulfilling their client’s business requirements.

BALANCE FOR BETTER

At Xapo, we embrace our differences and actively foster an inclusive environment where we all can thrive. We’re a flexible, family-friendly environment, and we recognize that everyone has commitments outside of work. We have a goal of reaching gender parity and strongly encourage women to apply to our open positions. Diversity is not a tagline at Xapo; it is our foundation.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop, enhance, test, support, maintain and debug software applications that support business units or support functions.
  • Work with internal teams to identify requirements and maintain a development schedule.
  • Analyze/identify gaps in functional/business requirements, discuss required changes with product owners to align with Salesforce product stack and architecture.
  • Develop end to end Salesforce solutions using Apex Class, Triggers, Visualforce pages, Lightning components etc.
  • Write technical approach and design documentation as required.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • 5+ years as a software developer.
  • Knowledge of product development lifecycle.
  • Knowledge of DevOps tools like GIT, Jenkins, JIRA etc.
  • Hands-on development experience using Salesforce configuration and customizations using Apex, triggers, etc.,
  • Experience defining/working with REST APIs
  • Oral and written proficiency in English.

PREFERRED SKILLS

  • Web development skills.
  • Python language.
  • Scrum experience.
  • Amazon Web Services.
  • Remote work experience.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • A dedicated workspace.
  • A reliable internet connection with the fastest speed possible in your area.
  • Devices and other essential equipment that meet minimal technical specifications.
  • Alignment with Our Values.

WHY WORK FOR XAPO?

  • Shape the Future: Improve lives through cutting-edge technology, work remotely from anywhere in the world
  • Own Your Success: Receive attractive remuneration, enjoy an autonomous work culture and flexible hours, apply your expertise to meaningful work every day
  • Expect Excellence: Collaborate, learn, and grow with a high-performance team

ABOUT XAPO

At Xapo, we’re building a way for users all over the world to send, receive, spend, and store their money globally and safely. We’re firm believers that no matter who you are or where you’re from, you deserve easy access to digital financial services.

Launched in 2014 by Wences Casares (CEO) & Federico Murrone (COO), Xapo has made an unparalleled investment in security infrastructure, assembled a renowned advisory board, and raised $40M from top venture capital firms in Silicon Valley & the world.

Xapo is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe a team that represents a variety of backgrounds and perspectives is critical to our success as a global company. A diverse, inclusive workplace enables us to create products that best serve our customers all around the world. It is the foundation of Xapo.

Apply for job

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Enterprise Web Solutions, IT Consulting, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: conovum AG | München, Deutschland

Remote details

Office Location: München, Deutschland. Employees can also work full time from this office.

abap
sapui5
html5
javascript

Job description

Bei conovum wirst du…

…in spannenden und abwechslungsreichen Projekten mit neuesten Technologien arbeiten.

…innovative und hochintegrierte Lösungen und Produkte erarbeiten und umsetzen.

…zusammen mit deinen Kollegen jeden Tag dazulernen, deine Potenziale voll ausschöpfen und auch mal die erste Geige spielen.

…Prozesse, IT-Systeme, Benutzeroberflächen und Schnittstellen konzipieren und realisieren.

Wir bei conovum …  

…sind ein lockeres und technikbegeistertes Team in einem modernen Unternehmen.

…können nicht nur programmieren, sondern auch gemeinsam lachen und feiern.

…zeichnen uns durch Verlässlichkeit, Stabilität und Unabhängigkeit aus.

…haben flexible Arbeitszeiten und leben eine familiäre Arbeitsatmosphäre mit zahlreichen Events.

…arbeiten in unseren Niederlassungen München und Rosenheim, bei unseren Kunden oder dort wo wir wohnen, beispielsweise in Mainz, Stuttgart, Landshut oder Cottbus.

Du …

…hast Informatik / Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Vergleichbares studiert und im Idealfall bereits Berufserfahrung.

…besitzt Leidenschaft für Entwicklungen und möchtest die feinen Noten von ABAP und SAPUI5 besser kennenlernen.

…hast Lust unser Orchester zu unterstützen, um klangvolle Ergebnisse abzuliefern.

Wenn du Teil des conovum-Orchesters werden möchtest, freuen wir uns darauf dich kennenzulernen.
Eine informelle E-Mail an career@conovum.de genügt.

Apply now

About conovum AG

Wir sind eine innovative IT-Beratung mit SAP-Schwerpunkt und umfassender Expertise in den Bereichen Business Travel, System Integration und Software Engineering. Mit technologischer Kompetenz sowie fachlichem und methodischem Know-how bewältigen wir komplexe Aufgaben mit einem lockeren und technikbegeisterten Team!

Unser Leistungsspektrum umfasst hierbei Consulting, Softwareprodukte sowie Custom Development. Ob Prozessberatung, Digitalisierung, Konzeption von end-to-end Prozessen, Automatisierung oder die Realisierung von hochintegrierten IT-Solutions, webClients, mobile Apps … wir sind überzeugt, dass Leistungsstärke, Substanz und Menschlichkeit unsere fachliche und technische Expertise erst richtig werthaltig machen.

Gemeinsam verfolgen wir im Team ein Ziel: Freude an erfolgreicher Arbeit durch gegenseitige Unterstützung, Wertschätzung und Respekt. Hierarchiestufenunabhängig leben wir eine Unternehmenskultur, die sich durch Vertrauen, Transparenz und Kommunikation auszeichnet. Sei dabei. Wir freuen uns auf dich.

Benefits

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Teilzeitregelungen
  • Flache Hierarchien
  • Möglichkeit zum Homeoffice
  • Tolle und besondere Teamevents
  • Kostenlose Getränke, Snackbar und das ein oder andere Feierabendbier
  • Familiäre Arbeitsatmosphäre
  • Moderne Arbeitsplätze, sonnige Dachterrasse
  • Individuelle Weiterbildung
  • Freie Wahl der Hardware
  • Bürohunde

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Job Description

Senior Vlocity and Salesforce Developer

Eagle Creek Software Services is a CRM, BI, and eCommerce services firm and the largest dedicated provider of on-shore and rural sourcing services in the US. Eagle Creek Software focuses on implementing, upgrading and extending the useful life of CRM, BI, and allied technologies. People are attracted to Eagle Creek for our focus; for our success, (rapid growth since 1999); for the opportunity to work on the largest and most innovative projects in the US with Fortune 1000 clients; and for our reputation for high quality.?

Competitive Advantage

Since 2005, Eagle Creek has leveraged US based on-shore/off-site Consultants in our multiple Technology Centers.? This has given us the ability to provide our customers with a cost-comparable alternative to off-shoring for many reasons:
  • Technology Centers in the heart of the United States
  • No more than 2 time zones away from the customer
  • No more than a half day trip to inspect a project or engagement
  • Dedicated technological focus ? CRM, BI, eCommerce
  • Six month training programs for every consultant
  • The capability of delivering any phase and any size engagement
  • Supported by the most extensive onsite consulting team in the industry
Value Proposition

Eagle Creek has over 2,500,000 hours of project experience spanning over 300 engagements. It is one of the only companies in the world with the experience and capabilities to successfully deliver multi-million dollar engagements remotely. The company?s value proposition is based exclusively on Quality?and?Price, where customers receive the highest quality in the industry at a price that is more cost effective than offshore and lower than traditional onsite service companies. The company?s Valley City, North Dakota Project Center primarily focuses on CRM and related technologies while the Pierre, South Dakota Project Center primarily focuses on Business Intelligence technologies, and the Vermillion, South Dakota and Eden Prairie, Minnesota Project centers focus on eCommerce development.

Duties
  • Participate in the development of? Salesforce applications based on client needs for integration, implementation, and customization projects
  • Mentor and train, formally and informally, Eagle Creek?s Jr. and mid-level resources
  • Foster and maintain development and integration standards, best practices and related deliverables?with the EC team
  • Participate in pre-sales efforts and strategic project planning
  • Ability to travel for initial project set-up and major milestones as required
  • Additional duties as required
Required Technical Skills
  • Some Vlocity experience or certification(s)
  • Bachelor?s degree in computer science, related field, or equivalent
  • 2+ years experience with end to end Salesforce.com implementations, integrations, and enhancement projects
  • 2+ years APEX and Visualforce development for custom Salesforce functionality
  • Experience integrating business processes across disparate systems and multiple Salesforce instances using web services, SOAP, XML, REST, MSMQ, workflow, XML, HTML, UML and JavaScript
  • Development of? custom objects, fields and formulas, custom reports, and dashboards
  • Integration experience with other Salesforce Applications and External systems
  • Development of SOAP and REST based web services used for custom development
  • Solid understanding of SaaS and CRM development processes and methodologies
  • Create supporting technical documentation and detailed design specifications
  • Develop and maintain validation rules and custom workflows
  • Salesforce development certification (highly desired)
  • Hands-on development skills
  • Knowledge about OOTB functionality and the ability to discern when to configure over code
Desired Technical Skills
  • 1+ years Vlocity development experience
  • Design and development of applications using the Force.com IDE
  • Java based web application development and OOP skills
  • Jitterbit or Informatica Cloud adapter for Salesforce
  • Certified Advanced Developer
Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

items.content:
Job title : Microsoft Navision Developer
Location : Remote/Anywhere
Type : Contract
Duration : 7-8 months

Job Description: Our newest team member will be responsible for designing solutions to business requirements through customization of the Microsoft Dynamics NAV. The position requires someone with a strong sense of good design principles, coding practices, and an analytical mind for approaching and solving problems logically and thoroughly. This position requires someone who will question and prod to find the best solution to a problem, and carry that solution through to production.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Assist with technical design for solutions to business requirements.
• Develop custom Dynamics NAV code to implement business requirements.
• Perform complex, intensive business-to-business integration development.
• Document designs and implementation.
REQUIREMENTS:
• Microsoft Certified Developer
• 8 - 10 Years of Dynamics NAV development experience.

items.title: Sr. Oracle Financials ORMB Support Engineer (100% Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Job Description
The Company
WorldPay is making payments smarter, faster and easier for all our partners, as well as the consumers they serve. From the largest retailers in the U.S. to the coffee shop down the street, we are leading the transformation in payments through chip-enabled cards, mobile wallets, eCommerce, and payment solutions for businesses of all sizes. We are the largest payments company in the World, first in PIN Debit transactions and the largest merchant acquirer. Visit Worldpay.com for more.
The Opportunity
As WorldPay grows, our need for skilled and seasoned IT professionals increases. Being a player in the payments processing industry requires a savvy team of experts who can easily navigate the often complex and sophisticated world of billing and the many applications included in a large business. By ensuring our systems are optimal, we can monitor and measure our successes and discover new areas for improvement.
RMB Application Support Engineer -- Will work with third parties and well as operation stakeholders to ensure daily/monthly billing activities within Oracle RMB work as expected. Expected to engage with upstream and downstream application support resources as well as data owners to troubleshoot issues enabling corrective action in a 24/7 environment. Typically requires 3 years of dedicated Oracle RMB experience preferably in a similar environment. WorldPay's fast, continued growth means as our systems become more complex, our need for detail-oriented people deepens.
Rewarding Impact. Fulfilling Careers.
Making an impact isn't something reserved for people in corner offices. At WorldPay, it comes from people in every corner of the office. Our goal is that you never stop learning and you never cease to amaze--especially yourself. If this fits your career goal, we can't wait to welcome you on board.
The Day-to-Day
Responsibilities:
  • Minimum of 3+ years of experience as an Oracle RMB support resource.
  • 24x7 on-call support, as required to ensure production and operational health of Oracle RMB.
  • Ability to collaborate and facilitate troubleshooting of advanced technical issues and work cross-organizationally (Development, Database, Server team, Platform and Product) along with other system application teams to resolve stability, performance or serviceability of Oracle RMB.
  • Engage with development on release planning and production readiness
  • Interface with Billing Leadership and interaction with stakeholders across IT and Operations.
  • Develop an in-depth understanding of Worldpay financial processing and develop trusted partnership with Billing Operations and stakeholders within Line-of-Business.
  • Ensure Oracle RMB deliverables meet or exceed all operational metrics (OLAs and SLAs), as defined.
  • Monitor and analyze daily and monthly run cycles.
  • Interact with End Users to address issues in a timely manner.
  • Ability to work within a team, including onshore and offshore resources.
Qualifications:
  • 3+ years supporting Oracle RMB
  • Understanding of business financial flows (month end billing, GL, merchant/partner payments, payment calculations, reporting and residual
  • Oracle EBS experience is a plus
  • Tivoli Scheduler experience a plus
  • Basic SQL knowledge is a plus
  • Agile experience is a plus
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work in a team-oriented sale-driven environment
  • Time management, ability to multitask and propensity to handle urgent interrupts with poise and professionalism
  • Collaboration and the ability to work effectively with internal/external customers as well as across the entire Sales Operations team are essential

Preferred Skills/Qualifications:
  • Experience of HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  • Proficiency in use of Eclipse or Visual Studio Code as an IDE
  • Experience of GIT, or similar source control system
  • Previous experience of working as part of an Agile project
  • Salesforce Administrator/Developer Certification preferred
  • Experience of building bespoke lightning components

The salary for the position is £50-60,000 plus an excellent benefits package including remote working (possibly 100%), bonus scheme, 25 days holiday, 4% pension, life assurance x4 and healthcare plan.

Please call Jonathan Maironis at Opus RS in Manchester on 0161 249 7242 for more information or send your latest CV to jonathan dot maironis at opusrs dot com

Permanent
£50,000 - £60,000 a year

items.title: Ksplice @ Oracle | Full Time | Remote | https://ksplice.oracle.com/ The Ksplice group at Oracle ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=12, other=1, dotnet=0, c=13, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Ksplice @ Oracle | Full Time | Remote | https://ksplice.oracle.com/

The Ksplice group at Oracle develops technology to patch the Linux kernel and applications while they are running, eliminating unplanned downtime for systems running Oracle Linux and keeping up-to-date with known security fixes. We're looking for a full stack software engineer and a systems engineer to join our team.

The full stack software engineer will help us expand the web services we provide to our customers and the tools needed to provide those services. You must be comfortable with the entire stack, from the Linux shell at the bottom to Python and Django (or similar) at the top (bonus points for experience with Terraform or Ansible). You must also be willing to assist with operational tasks. Expert knowledge of Python and web development as well as experience deploying to Linux is a must. Contact travis.jensen@oracle.com.

The systems engineer will help us Ksplice patch even more of the system, support new releases and improve our workflow. You'll like working at all levels of a Linux system, developing tooling in Python+bash, analyzing security vulnerabilities in Linux kernel patches, enhancing the Ksplice tools and improving the workflow. Expert level C/C++ programming, experience developing the Linux kernel and an understanding of security issues and defences in compiled languages are required. Contact jamie.iles@oracle.com.

More information about Ksplice is available at http://ksplice.oracle.com/. Oracle is an equal opportunity employer.

items.title: Oracle | Software Engineer | Oakland, CA | ONSITE/REMOTE | Full Time The Oracle Cloud ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=17, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Oracle | Software Engineer | Oakland, CA | ONSITE/REMOTE | Full Time

The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, Registry team is looking for a senior Scala software engineer. Our service is architected as an Event-Sourced, Distributed system built on CQRS principles. Our technology stack is Scala / Akka / Play. If you have ever wondered what it is like to apply Functional Programming principles in a live, production environment this is the role for you.

The Registry service is a managed, multi-tenant registry for Docker container images for customers who want to store and launch their containers on OCI, including Kubernetes users. In addition to working on interesting projects and the future of OCIR, you'll be getting a great salary, flexible working arrangements, a fun, state-of-the-art development environment and excellent opportunities for learning and career growth. Members of our team work on distributed systems in a cloud environment and have ownership of our service from top (Load Balancers) to bottom (Databases).

Please contact justin.ko@oracle.com

items.content:
Job Description

Senior Vlocity and Salesforce Developer

Eagle Creek Software Services is a CRM, BI, and eCommerce services firm and the largest dedicated provider of on-shore and rural sourcing services in the US. Eagle Creek Software focuses on implementing, upgrading and extending the useful life of CRM, BI, and allied technologies. People are attracted to Eagle Creek for our focus; for our success, (rapid growth since 1999); for the opportunity to work on the largest and most innovative projects in the US with Fortune 1000 clients; and for our reputation for high quality.?

Competitive Advantage

Since 2005, Eagle Creek has leveraged US based on-shore/off-site Consultants in our multiple Technology Centers.? This has given us the ability to provide our customers with a cost-comparable alternative to off-shoring for many reasons:
  • Technology Centers in the heart of the United States
  • No more than 2 time zones away from the customer
  • No more than a half day trip to inspect a project or engagement
  • Dedicated technological focus ? CRM, BI, eCommerce
  • Six month training programs for every consultant
  • The capability of delivering any phase and any size engagement
  • Supported by the most extensive onsite consulting team in the industry
Value Proposition

Eagle Creek has over 2,500,000 hours of project experience spanning over 300 engagements. It is one of the only companies in the world with the experience and capabilities to successfully deliver multi-million dollar engagements remotely. The company?s value proposition is based exclusively on Quality?and?Price, where customers receive the highest quality in the industry at a price that is more cost effective than offshore and lower than traditional onsite service companies. The company?s Valley City, North Dakota Project Center primarily focuses on CRM and related technologies while the Pierre, South Dakota Project Center primarily focuses on Business Intelligence technologies, and the Vermillion, South Dakota and Eden Prairie, Minnesota Project centers focus on eCommerce development.

Duties
  • Participate in the development of? Salesforce applications based on client needs for integration, implementation, and customization projects
  • Mentor and train, formally and informally, Eagle Creek?s Jr. and mid-level resources
  • Foster and maintain development and integration standards, best practices and related deliverables?with the EC team
  • Participate in pre-sales efforts and strategic project planning
  • Ability to travel for initial project set-up and major milestones as required
  • Additional duties as required
Required Technical Skills
  • Some Vlocity experience or certification(s)
  • Bachelor?s degree in computer science, related field, or equivalent
  • 2+ years experience with end to end Salesforce.com implementations, integrations, and enhancement projects
  • 2+ years APEX and Visualforce development for custom Salesforce functionality
  • Experience integrating business processes across disparate systems and multiple Salesforce instances using web services, SOAP, XML, REST, MSMQ, workflow, XML, HTML, UML and JavaScript
  • Development of? custom objects, fields and formulas, custom reports, and dashboards
  • Integration experience with other Salesforce Applications and External systems
  • Development of SOAP and REST based web services used for custom development
  • Solid understanding of SaaS and CRM development processes and methodologies
  • Create supporting technical documentation and detailed design specifications
  • Develop and maintain validation rules and custom workflows
  • Salesforce development certification (highly desired)
  • Hands-on development skills
  • Knowledge about OOTB functionality and the ability to discern when to configure over code
Desired Technical Skills
  • 1+ years Vlocity development experience
  • Design and development of applications using the Force.com IDE
  • Java based web application development and OOP skills
  • Jitterbit or Informatica Cloud adapter for Salesforce
  • Certified Advanced Developer
Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

Contract: 3 - 6 months
Day Rate: Competitive Day Rate/Perm Salary offered

ASAP Start

The Company

Our client is a market leader in their sector who provide their services to over 120 countries worldwide. The company has a turnover over £9m employing over 100+ staff and are currently going through an exciting stage of development within their IT Department.

You will be joining a vibrant and friendly team of 8 in IT as The Integra NG CRM) Config Developer where you will help the company transition their online presence with the release of a new CRM data. Working alongside another Integra NG CRM Developer you will be required to bring your expertise and experience working with Integra NG CRM'S configuring systems, writing SQL.

The Company are interested in speaking with candidates that are open to contract/perm opportunities.

What you will do:

The Integra NG CRM Developer will provide high quality operational and technical application development and systems support to customers and internal business functions by analysing, designing and coding, testing and implementing systems to meet customer requirements. Minimising the adverse impact of incidents and problems on the business and preventing reoccurrence of Incidents. Manage the configuration of applications and control of software releases.

The post holder will be responsible for the development and support of applications. Be required to input into all new infrastructure changes that may have an impact on the development and support of applications. Be responsible for maintaining and improving the relationship with external support providers, third party developers and business departments both during the project life cycle and post go live. As an integral member of the IT team the post holder will be required to assist in all areas of the service provided by the team.

You will be working alongside project managers, infrastructure support, 3rd party contractors and consultants and application analyst whilst providing recommendation to the IT Managers.

Responsibilities:

  • The Integra NG CRM Developer will enable the escalation process to alert senior management to critical issues and serious operational events.
  • Provides application development capability around the existing packages including Integra NG CRM and using VBScript, Orbis Task Manager, SQL, SSRS and webservices (REST and SOAP)
  • Preparation of information to feed into the budgetary process
  • Produces and gain agreement of requirements specifications, where appropriate
  • Produces functional specifications - where appropriate
  • Produce and agree the architecture to support application projects with the relevant teams.
  • Management of third-party applications including supplier's activities.
  • Supports the IT Manager in:
  • Configuration management
  • Providing Quality Control for applications
  • Change Management
  • Release Management
  • Input into Project plans
  • Application Status Reports
  • Supporting system & application testing to agreed standards
  • Working with project delivery teams to ensure that projects take account of the support implications in relation to new applications or system
  • Assists in acceptance and formal sign off of applicable projects

Apply today for the role of The Integra NG CRM Developer as successful candidates will be contacted within 48 hours.

items.title: Remote Salesforce Developer/Administrator (US Citizen only Fed Client)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
This position is responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of Salesforce and other custom database and EDI applications.

Will office in Reston, VA

ESSENTIAL DUTIES RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

  • Customize SQL-based database application solutions within the Salesforce platform to support business functions and meet project objectives and company goals.
  • Manage daily support and maintenance of our Salesforce instance, SQL application and conduct long-term improvements and upgrades.
  • Communicate and collaborate with project managers and user stake-holders to design intelligent and effective business solutions.
  • Provide system administration support of internal and customer-facing Salesforce environment, especially related to customized applications, user permissions, security settings, custom objects, workflows and daily data transfers.
  • Work with IT team to develop business requirements, process flows, and application designs.
  • Integrate Salesforce with other existing business applications.
  • Write SQL queries for application-based searches and reports.
  • Develop user-requested reports, dashboards, forms, views and new data fields.
  • Create and update workflows as requirements change.
  • Develop and maintain API code and s-controls to support custom development interfaces.
  • Develop programs in Salesforce Apex, Javascript and other supporting languages and APIs.
  • Develop and maintain programs in the AS/400 environment using RPG.
  • Assist in the migration of code, processes, business and business logic from the AS/400 environment to other platforms.
  • Serve as primary point of contact for developing and prioritizing all change requests, system alterations, and customization.
  • Partner with cross functional teams to produce requirements and designs for business capabilities that align to company s business and technology strategies providing guidance on Salesforce matter expertise.
  • Create and maintain documentation of key project artifacts, processes and system functionality/tools.
  • Own Salesforce Administration responsibilities and hands on implementation of all administration needs from beginning to end.
  • Generate visualization and reports/dashboards on Salesforce to satisfy business reporting requirements.
  • Monitor new Salesforce release features and functionality and provide recommendations for process improvements.
  • Coordinate testing, upgrades and configuration of system files and services.
  • Assist in the technical rollout of future enhancements.
  • Other design, development and programming duties as assigned.
  • Other IT related duties and responsibilities as requested.

QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION, CERTIFICATIONS AND/OR EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Science, Applied Science, Math, Business Analytics, Project Management, Business or a related discipline or equivalent experience and certifications preferred.
  • 3+ years of experience with Salesforce in a solutions development and maintenance capacity.
  • 3+ years of experience designing, developing and maintaining SQL-based business database application.
  • Multiple Salesforce project deployments including release and environment management a big plus.
  • Current Salesforce certifications ADM-201, DEV 401, DEV501 a plus and preferred.
  • Proficient with Salesforce Lightning Experience, Apex, VisualForce, Native, MySQL and JavaScript
  • Proficient with SQL applications, queries and reports.
  • Project Management Institute Program Management Professional (PgMP) or Project Management Professional (PMP) certification, Project Management Agile Practitioner (PMI-ACP) or equivalent project management or business analyst certification preferred.
  • Experience with AS/400 iSeries and RPG a big plus.
  • Experience and expertise in communicating with user stakeholders and non-technical staff.
  • Demonstrated experience designing and deploying custom developed solutions on the Salesforce platform.
  • Hands-on experience with Salesforce Sales Cloud and Service Cloud.
  • Experience using integrated development environments (IDE).
  • Experience managing deployment and understanding deployment best practices.
  • Experience writing code which integrates directly with webservices.
  • Experience with Data Specialist Inc. Dairy ERP (DSI) SQL-based business application a big plus.
  • Experience with AS/400 iSeries and RPG a big plus.

Other Skills and Abilities

  • Background in SDLC/Agile development methodologies.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work in a cross functional team environment.
  • Excellent attention to detail and complex problem-solving capabilities.
  • Competency in documenting business requirements.
  • Comfortable being the resident in-house Salesforce expert.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
SELECT SOURCE INTERNATIONAL

Select Source International (SSI) has been serving major corporations for more than 15 years. At SSI, we believe in building a corporation with only the strongest and most capable individuals. Our world-class consultants have the expertise to meet our clients demands. Here at SSI, we pride ourselves on the fundamental belief that our team is essential to our company's growth. We assist our consultants every step of the way in order to match them to the best possible position for their skills.

Job Role: SAS Programmer

Location: Groton, CT (100% remote option)

Duration: 6 Months


Job Description:

Performs all SAS programming required for clinical trial analysis and reporting.

Ensures that activities and processes performed are conducted according to sponsor requirements.

Works closely with the Biostatistics and Data Management departments on various clinical projects.

Leads programming efforts for large complex studies.

Requires time management skills, and strong SAS programming expertise.

Reviews case report form (CRF) design. Designs and/or reviews database structure.

Writes edit checks from the Data Cleaning Plan (DCP) specifications.

Creates derived-analysis datasets.

Executes analyses specified in the Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) or Report and Analysis Plans (RAP) under the guidance of the project statistician.

Acts as primary programmer to produce tables, listings, and figures for the clinical study report (CSR).

Acts as secondary programmer to validate SAS programs that produce derived-analysis datasets and data analyses. Years of Experience 5-7.

A productive, hands on programmer who applies technical knowledge and practical experience to deliver statistical programming deliverables to support assets and study teams with limited supervision early in role and independently later in role.

Ensures excellence in the programming of analysis ready datasets, tables, listings, and figures for which they are responsible Ensures adherence to high quality programming standards in their daily work.

Accountable for the quality and timely delivery of datasets and displays required for their clinical study reports as well as other asset level deliverables they may be programming

Ensures appropriate documentation and QC across the lifespan of the study for all of their programming deliverables

Exhibits routine and occasionally complex problem solving skills, seeking direction when appropriate.

Works with statisticians and programming leads to ensure clear specifications for their programmed deliverables are in place.

Will be knowledgeable in core safety standards as well as TA standards pertinent to their project, may aid in development of standards necessary for their study

May contribute to department level initiatives.

ROLE SUMMARY

Summarize the primary purpose & key accountabilities of the role, including geographical scope (i.e. Global vs. Country/Region). Summary should be concise and include strategic information that would attract candidates to the role. It may be helpful to complete this section after you have finished the other sections of the document.

A productive, hands on programmer who applies technical knowledge and practical experience to deliver statistical programming deliverables to support assets and study teams with limited supervision early in role and independently later in role.

Ensures excellence in the programming of analysis ready datasets, tables, listings, and figures for which they are responsible

Ensures adherence to high quality programming standards in their daily work.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES

Accountable for the quality and timely delivery of datasets and displays required for their clinical study reports as well as other asset level deliverables they may be programming

Ensures appropriate documentation and QC across the lifespan of the study for all of their programming deliverables

Exhibits routine and occasionally complex problem solving skills, seeking direction when appropriate.

Works with statisticians and programming leads to ensure clear specifications for their programmed deliverables are in place.

Will be knowledgeable in core safety standards as well as TA standards pertinent to their project, may aid in development of standards necessary for their study

May contribute to department level initiatives.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor or Master (preferred) Degree in Statistics, Biological Sciences, IT, or related field.

At least 3 years relevant experience in a pharmaceutical, biotech, CRO, or Regulatory Agency.

Statistical Programming and SAS hand-on experience

Clinical trials expertise with an understanding of data operations required for the reporting of clinical trial data.

Good understanding of ICH and regulatory guidelines

Working knowledge of clinical data and relevant data standards

Strong written and oral communication skills, and project management skills

Proven ability to operate with limited oversight

Knowledge of at least 1 Therapeutic Area

Proven ability to manage delivery under tight timelines.

CDISC experience desirable

Note: Selected candidates will be required to submit to a Background Check and a Drug Screen.

Best Regards,

Deepak Singh Tomar

Cell: , W: x 5050

Deepakt(at)selectsourceintl(dot)com

13911 Ridgedale Drive Suite 230 Minnetonka, Minnesota 55305

items.content:
Stefanini is looking for a REMOTE Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer. This role is responsible for delivering high quality technical work, including setup, code, configuration, and validation, to enable a large-scale, complex implementation of the Salesforce Marketing Cloud. The person in this role MUST have extensive Marketing Cloud development and implementation experience, and be able to confidently design & enable complexities beyond a simple CRM connection - for example, multi-org connections, conflicting visibility requirements when connecting to a Salesforce CRM system, roles, sharing & visibility in CRM and their effects on marketing, migration from other marketing systems, etc.

The role is comprised of two main elements: requirements review & technical design, in collaboration with the lead technical architect and functional/business team members, and completion of configuration and development efforts in a timely and effective manner, while working with other US-based and offshore development team members.

This implementation of the Marketing Cloud will be completed in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with multiple stakeholders, an international virtual team, and a tight series of deadlines; this role must be collaborative, a self-starter and team player, who can help drive the team to succeed and who is willing to pitch in wherever necessary to help the team get to Done.

Responsibilities:

Attend daily Agile standups and provide concise updates regarding completed effort and any blockers or concerns

Quickly come up to speed on a large and complex multinational Salesforce CRM implementation, to best advise on Marketing Cloud design & setup needs

Complete setup of environment, connection to CRM, configuration of business units & other critical Marketing Cloud functionality, development **in both the CRM and the Marketing systems** to enable required business outcome

Join selected meetings with business users to understand requirements

Interface with US-based and offshore team members, with clean handoffs of code & other responsibilities, to ensure effective development

5+ years experience in software development life cycle

5+ year experience in Salesforce development and implementing Marketing systems

3+ years experience with Exact Target/Salesforce Marketing Cloud

Salesforce Administrator certification, Salesforce Developer Certification, and Marketing Cloud Consultant certification

Experience in enterprise-level Salesforce projects using agile software development methodologies throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success

Expert level understanding of the Salesforce Sales and Marketing Cloud solutions, as well as the Force.com Platform. Lightning experience a plus but not required.

Experience with Salesforce Development and general salesforce components such as objects, fields, workflow rules, field updates, process builder, apex classes, triggers, test classes, etc.

Must be strong in various Marketing Cloud areas - Email Studio, Automation Studio, Mobile Studio, Journey Builder, MC Connect, Audience Builder, Data Extensions, etc.

Experience with object-oriented program languages especially strong in APEX, Visualforce, HTML, CSS, Javascript, Jquery, SOQL and SQL queries.

Must have AmpScript experience.

Knowledge or exposure to Marketing Cloud Connect Integration

Experience with managing Campaigns using the Campaign and Campaign Members objects, direct mail integration/data management, and social media/customer service integration

Experience working with Multiple Business Units in Marketing Cloud and knowledgeable about Audience Segmentation

Familiarity with multi-org connector is a huge plus.

Familiarity with Marketing Cloud API is a huge plus.

Eloqua Experience a huge plus.

Education Required: Minimum Bachelor s degree - preferred in Computer Science or related field, but not required (or equivalent experience)

Interested applicants may click the apply button or you may call us at for faster processing. Thank you.
- provided by Dice
